reviewText: Without a doubt, this is the most fascinating look into homocide ever done on television. The detectives are master-interrogators, the keenest observers and just (awe)some in so many ways.This show totally ruined CSI and a couple other "cop-shows" that I used to enjoy. No more drama, ever again. I will only watch the first 48 because it is so intense!
summary: the absolute best thing on TV

reviewText: I began watching "The First 48" when it started over 5 years ago and have been hooked since. Tuesdays and Thursdays are my "First 48 nights", so no one better bother me, lol.Over the course of the series I have come to really admire and enjoy watching many of the particular cities and homicide detectives, mainly the Memphis, Dallas and Miami teams.Gotta Say Det Mason is one of the most unique (and high maintenance) individuals I have seen, but she does her job well and gets her suspects to 'fess up a majority of the time. Mullins, Collins, Lundy ,Castillo, Tamayo, Castellanos and John are also fascinating to watch as they interrogate their suspects. The detectives also demonstrate their keen abilities to connect with the worst of the worst to comforting the victims and families affected by tragedy.I have learned that interrogation is more than questioning someone in order to obtain information, but it's a science in itself that is mastered over time. One must build rapport with a suspect and gain their trust as well.This is a top notch show that is not only educational, but despite the gory aspects of death which predominate the episodes, can also be a bit entertaining.Given the spate of garbage that's on TV, this is a must see show.
summary: One of the BEST shows, period
Title: N/A

reviewText: HOW GOOD IS THIS....Its Fantastic. I stayed up late into the night watching this. Couldnt drag myself away from it all. They go right into these crimes, you see the suspects in the police station rooms been interviewed by the detectives. Some are released when the police are satisfied that this person was not involved in the Murder. The first 48 hours is the most important time for the police, they must try and get there man. After that the case begins to go COLD. I got to know these group of men and women detectives very well, and even felt they were my friends. I saw them at play. I watched them laughing and jokeing. And i saw the very serious side of them too.  When they are called out to gruesome murders. The long hours that they are required to put in, stoping at a diner just for a quick eat, then its back on the road again. A great 2 disc series. One you could watch again, AND AGAIN.
